reference.title: nodeadmin-pack-instance
reference.shortdesc: The nodeadmin-pack-instance command allows you to migrate instances offline from one Node Controller (NC) to another. It packs an instance from libvirt and places the output artifacts into a packed file.

row.entry: Display the manual page for the command.

Pack all the instances on the node controller (NC).
* Must specify one option: all or a specific instance.

Name of the source instance to pack and the name of the output file.
* Must specify one option: all or a specific instance.

Location to store the resulting packed file(s).
If you do not specify an output directory, the default is where you run the command.
The default is to suspend the instance during the pack operation. If you want to shut down the instance before packing, include this option.
If you want to see more details and progress during the pack operation, include this option.
The default is to compress the packed output to minimize the file size. However, this takes more time. If time is more important than output size, include this option.

The host and port of the Storage Controller (SC). One per zone.
To find these, run from the CLC: euserv-describe-services --filter service-type=storage --expert

Path to the root of the Eucalyptus installation, which is system root / for a package-based installation, must be set so that the cryptographic credentials can be found.
Default: EUCALYPTUS=/

The dynamic library search path must be set to include several Axis2 libraries.
Default: LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$AXIS2C_HOME/lib:$AXIS2C_HOME/modules/rampart

section.title: About nodeadmin-pack-instance
section.p:
The nodeadmin-pack-instance command makes the following changes to the instance artifacts in the /var/lib/eucalyptus/instances/work/ACCOUNT_KEY_ID/INSTANCE_ID directory:
Dumps RAM to disk in a file named INSTANCE_ID-ram.save.
For each block device found in the libvirt configuration defined by instance-libvirt.xml and instance.xml:
Uses the "dd" command to save the entire device state to a *-block.save file.
Changes symbolic links such as "link-to-vda" to "/dev/mapper/euca-..." to "link-to-vda.orig" and a new link such as "link-to-vda" creates a *-block.save file.
Updates instance-libvirt.xml to change the block device to a file device.
Appends the original instance-libvirt.xml with .orig and saves a new version.

section.title: If nodeadmin-pack-instance fails
section.p:
In case of failure, you can roll back manually:
Delete all link-to-vd* files.
Rename the link-to-vd*.orig files by removing the .orig.
Delete the instance-libvirt.xml file.
Rename the instance-libvirt.xml.orig file by removing the .orig.
Delete the *-block.save files.
Run the following command: virsh restore INSTANCE_ID-ram.save
If you get an error such as: "Failed to open file '/dev/disk/by-id/scsi-1IET_00040001': No such file or directory" you can reconnect all volumes that were attached to the instance using this command on the NC: /usr/libexec/eucalyptus/nodeadmin-manage-volume-connections ConnectVolumes -s SC_HOST_PORT -i INSTANCE For example: /usr/libexec/eucalyptus/nodeadmin-manage-volume-connections ConnectVolumes -s 203.0.113.13:8773 -i i-356e4f34
